activities.loc: Courtroom D, Fourth Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Virgil Lee Tate Jr.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on December 13, 2022 at 08:45 am.

10:20 AM Defendant Virgil Lee Tate Jr. appeared by video, in custody at Dodge Correctional.  Attorney Ryan W O'Hara in court for Virgil Lee Tate Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Mary Elizabeth Bricco in court for the State of Wisconsin. Remand to Branch 7 for scheduling.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 08:45 am.
Calendar call on October 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Activity: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

10:10 AM Defendant Virgil Lee Tate in court in custody by video at the Rock County Jail with attorney Ryan W O'Hara by video. Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily. Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived. Defendant's attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set. Bond to continue.
Preliminary hearing on June 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Activity: Adjourned initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

2:32 PM Defendant Virgil Lee Tate in court in custody by video at the Rock County Jail with attorney Ryan W O'Hara by video. David Zarwell appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing requested by zoom.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Notice of Hearing for Adjourned Initial Appearance on May 27, 2022 at 2:30 PM (Defendant Virgil Lee Tate Jr.)
Adjourned initial appearance on May 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Activity:  Adjourned initial appearance  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:14 PM Defendant Virgil Lee Tate in court in custody by video from the Rock County Jail with attorney Faun Moses by video on behalf of Ryan W O'Hara.  Kyle Edward Johnson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Adjourned initital appearance scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 2:30 PM.
